Package entities

Class Mission

java.lang.Object
entities.Mission
All Implemented Interfaces:
MissionI
public class Mission
extends java.lang.Object
implements MissionI
Represents a mission in a game or simulation. A mission is defined by a unique code, version, a battlefield, and associated properties such as enemies, items, entry and exit points, and a specific target.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Mission​(java.lang.String code, int version, CustomNetwork<Room> battlefield)
    Creates a new mission with a specified code, version, and battlefield.

  • Constructor Details

    • Mission

      public Mission​(java.lang.String code, int version, CustomNetwork<Room> battlefield)
      Creates a new mission with a specified code, version, and battlefield. This constructor initializes the mission's battlefield, sets the code and version, and prepares empty lists for enemies, items, and entry/exit points. The target is initially unset, and the targetSecured status is false.
      Parameters:
      code - the unique identifier for the mission
      version - the version number of the mission
      battlefield - a network structure representing the battlefield, composed of connected rooms

  • Method Details

    • getVersion

      public int getVersion()
      Retrieves the version number of the mission.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the version of the mission.

    • setEnemy

      public void setEnemy​(Enemy enemy) throws NotElementComparableException
      Adds an enemy to the mission's list of enemies.
      Specified by:
      setEnemy in interface MissionI
      Parameters:
      enemy - the enemy to be added to the mission
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the enemy cannot be added due to non-comparability

    • setItem

      public void setItem​(Item item) throws NotElementComparableException
      Adds an item to the mission's list of items.
      Specified by:
      setItem in interface MissionI
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be added to the mission
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the item cannot be added due to non-comparability

    • setEntryExitPoint

      public void setEntryExitPoint​(Room entry_exit_point) throws NotElementComparableException
      Adds a room to the list of entry and exit points for the mission. This method allows specifying rooms that can act as both entry and exit points.
      Specified by:
      setEntryExitPoint in interface MissionI
      Parameters:
      entry_exit_point - the room to be added as an entry and exit point
      Throws:
      NotElementComparableException - if the room cannot be added due to non-comparability

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget​(Target target)
      Sets the target for the mission. The target specifies the key objective or location associated with the mission, including details such as the room and type associated with the target.
      Specified by:
      setTarget in interface MissionI
      Parameters:
      target - the Target object representing the mission's objective or location

    • setTargetSecured

      public void setTargetSecured​(boolean targetSecured)
      Sets the status indicating whether the mission's target has been secured.
      Specified by:
      setTargetSecured in interface MissionI
      Parameters:
      targetSecured - a boolean value where true indicates the target has been secured, and false indicates it has not.

    • getEnemies

      public LinkedList<Enemy> getEnemies()
      Retrieves the list of enemies associated with the mission.
      Specified by:
      getEnemies in interface MissionI
      Returns:
      a LinkedList containing all enemies in the mission

      public LinkedList<Room> getEntryExitPoints()
      Retrieves the list of entry and exit points associated with the mission.
      Specified by:
      getEntryExitPoints in interface MissionI
      Returns:
      a LinkedList of Room objects that represent the entry and exit points for the mission.

    • getBattlefield

      public CustomNetwork<Room> getBattlefield()
      Retrieves the battlefield associated with the mission. The battlefield is represented as a network of connected rooms.
      Specified by:
      getBattlefield in interface MissionI
      Returns:
      a CustomNetwork of Room objects representing the mission's battlefield

    • getTarget

      public Target getTarget()
      Retrieves the target associated with the mission. The target specifies the key objective or location associated with the mission, typically including details such as the room and type associated with the target.
      Specified by:
      getTarget in interface MissionI
      Returns:
      the Target object representing the mission's objective or location.

    • isTargetSecured

      public boolean isTargetSecured()
      Checks whether the mission's target has been secured.
      Specified by:
      isTargetSecured in interface MissionI
      Returns:
      true if the target is secured, false otherwise.

    • getCode

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compares this Mission object to another object to determine equality. Two Mission objects are considered equal if they have the same code and version.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the Object to be compared for equality with this Mission
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this Mission; false otherwise
